cognitive_context.problem_understanding: Creating a comprehensive, world-class wedding planning system for November 2026 wedding. Need to track guests, vendors, budget, metrics, and timeline. Key insight: This is NOT a software project but a data-driven wedding planning repository with version control.
attempted_solutions: Initial timeline assessment was too alarmist (claimed 6-12 months behind) - USER CORRECTED with research
Created CSV-based tracking system for flexibility (can import to Excel/Google Sheets)
Built HTML dashboard for visual overview (mobile-responsive, self-contained)
Implemented GitHub Pages for easy sharing without external hosting costs
key_insights: User is detail-oriented and will fact-check assertions - provide sources
12-month planning timeline is STANDARD for weddings, not behind schedule
Guest count has complexities: Jordyn 30, Ryan 15-20, Combined 33 (28 adults + 5 kids) - needs clarification
Thanksgiving 2026 is November 26 - must avoid November 28 wedding date
User prefers direct GitHub Pages URL over URL shorteners (looks less scammy)
Metadata and attribution are important - all files must show creator and dates
dead_ends: Initial TIMELINE_ANALYSIS.md was overly alarmist and factually incorrect
Model ID attribution in files - user requested change to 'Ryan Zimmerman'
Specific guest questions (Jared & Alfredo, '30 people' meaning) - changed to generic TBD language
assumptions: Wedding is November 2026 (exact date TBD, placeholder: Nov 15)
Budget not yet established (placeholder estimates around $15K)
User has GitHub account (rzimmerman2022) and repository exists
uncertainties: Final guest list and reconciliation of different counts
Which vendors are actually top priority vs nice-to-have

modified_files.wedding_guest_list.csv: 31-column guest tracking with RSVP, attendance, dietary restrictions
modified_files.wedding_budget_tracker.csv: 27 expense categories with estimated vs actual costs
modified_files.wedding_vendor_tracker.csv: 13+ vendor types with contact info and decision tracking
modified_files.wedding_metrics_registry.csv: 24 metric definitions with formulas and owners
modified_files.wedding-dashboard.html: Mobile-responsive HTML dashboard with card-based UI
modified_files.CHANGELOG.md: Semantic versioning with all session changes
modified_files.docs/TIMELINE_ANALYSIS.md: Detailed month-by-month planning (contains old alarmist language - needs update)
modified_files..gitignore: Privacy protection for sensitive wedding data

technical_debt_added: TIMELINE_ANALYSIS.md still contains 'CRITICAL - IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED' language that contradicts corrected timeline
Guest count discrepancies need resolution (multiple different numbers across documents)
Budget placeholders all set to 0 or TBD - need actual data
Placeholder countdown date (2026-11-15) needs to be updated once actual date chosen

decision_log.decision: Use CSV files instead of database or spreadsheet-native format
decision_log.rationale: Flexibility to import into Excel/Google Sheets, version control friendly, plain text for git diffs

decision_log.decision: Create standalone HTML dashboard with inline CSS
decision_log.rationale: Self-contained file, no external dependencies, works offline, mobile-responsive

decision_log.decision: Correct timeline from 'behind schedule' to 'on schedule' based on user research
decision_log.rationale: User provided detailed research showing 12 months = standard planning timeline

decision_log.decision: Add comprehensive APA 7 bibliography with 29 sources
decision_log.rationale: User values research credibility, professional documentation, fact-checking capability

decision_log.decision: Change all attribution from model IDs to 'Ryan Zimmerman'
decision_log.rationale: User explicitly requested this for ownership clarity

decision_log.decision: Use GitHub Pages instead of URL shorteners or third-party hosting
decision_log.rationale: Free, permanent, professional URL, auto-updates on git push, user prefers over bit.ly

decision_log.decision: Remove specific guest name questions, replace with generic 'TBD' language
decision_log.rationale: User requested removal of questions about Jared & Alfredo and '30 people' requirement

immediate_tasks: Update TIMELINE_ANALYSIS.md to match corrected 'on schedule' messaging
Resolve guest count discrepancies once user provides clarification
Update countdown anchor date once exact wedding date is chosen
Fill in budget estimates once user establishes total budget
investigation_needed: How do the different guest counts relate? (Jordyn 30, Ryan 15-20, Combined 33)
What is the actual total budget?
Which date in November 2026 is preferred?
Is TIMELINE_ANALYSIS.md still useful or should it be archived?
blocked_items: Venue booking guidance (blocked on: date selection and budget)
Guest list finalization (blocked on: user input on actual names)
Budget allocation (blocked on: total budget establishment)
